features: Up to 22TB of space to back up and save your valuable project work. (1TB = 1 trillion bytes. Actual user capacity may be less depending on operating environment.)

Ultra-reliable 7200RPM Ultrastar enterprise-class hard drive inside for long-term storage and up to 260MB/s transfer speeds. (1 MB/s = 1 million bytes per second. Based on internal testing; performance may vary depending upon host device & other factors.)
PRO-BLADE SSD Mag slot (10Gbps) to easily add SSD capacity and performance for fast transfers, editing, and backup without adding to your workspace. (PRO-BLADE SSD Mag sold separately.)
High-performance Thunderbolt 3 (40Gbps) interface and USB (10Gbps) compatibility.
Color-coded cable indicators to connect the right cables and get the most out of your device performance.
body.description: The SanDisk Professional G-DRIVE PROJECT is made for makers. Transfer, edit, and archive large volumes of high-value content daily. The workflow is fast and simple, so you can focus on the content, and have peace of mind about your storage.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.5 4.5 out of 5 stars 270 ratings 4.5 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Manage High-volume Projects with Ease. Transfer, edit, and archive large volumes of high-value content daily. The workflow is fast and simple, so you can focus on the content, and have peace of mind about your external hard drive.

High-capacity and Fast Data Transfers Back up or add extra storage to your computer for your content with high-speed data transfers up to 260MB/s read and write (2) [18TB and 22TB capacities (1)] using the Thunderbolt 3 (40Gbps) port. 7200RPM Ultrastar Enterprise-class HDD Inside For your demanding workloads and mission-critical content, you can rely on the power and enhanced reliability of the 7200RPM Ultrastar enterprise-class hard drive inside. Premium Enclosure With a premium, anodized aluminum housing, the SanDisk Professional G-DRIVE PROJECT external HDD pairs beautifully with your high-end computer and computer accessories.

PRO-BLADE SSD Mag Slot Offload, make copies, or edit from a PRO-BLADE SSD Mag(3) through the new PRO-BLADE SSD Mag slot on your external hard drivesat blazing fast speeds. Color-Coded Cable Indicators Easily identify each port type with the color identifying system from SanDisk Professional. Match the colors to quickly connect your devices. Pairs Great with iPad(4) G-DRIVE PROJECT is compatible with iPad tablets that have a USB Type-C port to enable efficient creative workflows when using production apps(4). Brightness Customization Choose between three modes of brightness to easily brighten, dim, or turn off the power saving LED light with the push of a button.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: very good product, fast shipment to poland

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent build quality and speeds are as expected
reviews.reviewText: My purchase was for the G-Drive PRO, which is a mechanical hard drive, not an SSD.There are some reviews for this drive on Amazon that say the speeds are terrible. Do not listen to them. They do not understand that this is NOT an SSD, it is an enterprise class SATA mechanical hard drive in a TB3 case. The bottleneck here is the mechanical hard drive. There are people complaining that this is not a "40gb capable drive". This is laughable pure ignorance of the technology and what they purchased. The mechanical hard drive inside is NOWHERE near capable of 40gb speeds. If you need huge mass storage the G-Drive PRO is an excellent drive. If you need the absolute fastest speeds then you should buy the SSD version. Just do your research to understand the technology you are buying.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Warning! - this is formatted for Mac OS and will not be recognized by Windows.
reviews.reviewText: The drive is excellent, but must be formatted for Windows. The online User Manual for this drive (G-Drive) at westerndigital.com contains detailed instructions to perform this step. The instructions refer to a Command Line prompt available by right-clicking the Start Menu, but I did not see this option for Windows 11. Instead, I use the [windows]+R key to bring up the command prompt. That allowed the necessary commands to be entered and the drive ultimately formatted correctly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works ok. Few issues.
reviews.reviewText: The storage is fine. It is the accessibility and speed that has issues. I find that I am having an issue with the use of the video files. Using a Mac Studio. When a video is open in the file the playback bar is missing until I switch and come back to it. This only happens sometimes. I also noticed it is a lot slower than using a SSD for storage. The upload/download times are noticeably different.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Love it, holds everything u need it to hold

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I have dozens of these drives for storing film footage. I used large LaCie drives for a while but had two of those freeze. (The Rugged ones seem more reliable). So far, over a period of years, these SanDisk drives have been solid and reliable which is all that I ask.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I was surprised with the difference in speed. Impressive.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars I would not buy this product!
reviews.reviewText: The machine was very noisy in terms of the stylus seeking information on the disk. The advertised transfer speeds were not present either.The unit ran extremely hot and made very loud noises, like all units that are not controlled by the USB port, it was on all the time.Very disappointed in these products.I have invested in LaCie products recommended by Apple as I was connecting this drive to the new Mac Studio computer.Not only were the LaCie products less expensive but they work very, very, well.I believe Western Digital is a valuable player in the small portable market but I won’t invest in any of their desktop products going forward.

Bought 7.68 TB G-Drive Pro SSD - So far so go. Speed and reliability is what really matter when it comes to external drives. Though my 4 year old Mac comes with its own 4 TB SSD which is even way faster than today's fastest aftermarket SSD available. But I needed more space and this drive comes a bit closer to Mac's internal Apple's SSD, and am happy with it. But SSDs are still very expensive, prices need to come down.I am mostly using it for my music library (DSD and AIFFs) and a couple of large photo libraries. However, 7 TB feels less than half of what I really need today.

reviews.reviewTitle: What you get, is what you wanted!
reviews.reviewText: The device was easy to plug in, and offered me right away (on my Mac) the 12 TB of Sorge I needed. I used it for a Carbon Copy Cloner target, and that worked great, and I had been using another 10 TB drive as a Time Machine drive backup medium, so now with twi G-drives (10TB + 12TB) I am fully backed-up and protected. This is a good company, with good products that I fully endorse!
Absolutely love these. Buy them all the time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works in silence - can not hear it
Useless - Every time you save to it you need an administrator password
reviews.reviewText: I bought this because the new iMacs have so little storage but it is nearly useless. Every time you need to save a file to it you need to enter a password.This is absurd "security" and the only person it keeps out is the user. Ok as an archive but useless as storage.
